page.title: 11LAMPLUGH FELL FARM
page.content: Cockley Gill has: 117 acres, 1 acre of woodland, 37 cows, 26 calves, 17 hens, 200 Swaledale sheep, 250 lambs and 4 tips (rams). The farmer likes looking after the sheep and cows. His tractors are used to make hay, silage, spreading muck and fertiliser and feeding the stock there is a David Brown and Massey Ferguson tractor. The sheep are clipped in June. When the sheep have been sheared the fleeces are sent to the British Wool Marketing Board, Carnforth. The wool is sold to people who spin the wool and make jumpers and rugs. Another important job is to look after the cattle and feed them. The cows aren't milked because it is a fell farm and the calves are sent away for beef. The Lister's have lived on the farm for 8 years now. The farm has a lot of grass to keep the cattle.
